  • Reference

Low-level implementations of ei_ridge() and ei_riesz()

Source: R/ei_ridge.R, R/ei_riesz.R
ei_impl.Rd

No checks are performed on the inputs. Use of ei_ridge() and ei_riesz() is strongly recommended unless many regressions must be fit, e.g., within a tight loop. Only works for a single outcome, i.e., y must be a vector, not a matrix.

Usage

ei_ridge_impl(x, y, z, weights, penalty = NULL)

ei_riesz_impl(x, z, weights, penalty)

Arguments

x

A matrix of predictors

y

A vector of outcomes

z

A matrix of covariates

weights

A vector of unit weights

penalty

The ridge penalty, which must be specified. Recommended value is the same penalty used in ei_ridge(), which is stored in the penalty entry of the fitted model object.

Value

A list with model components.

On this page
